doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Q2 Sales Beat Australia Acquisition Closed REIT Buy Q2 Sales Beat Australia Acquisition Closed REIT Buy_2025-08-29

passages.text: Canada | Discount Retailers
Q2 Sales Beat, Australia acquisition Closed; REIT Buy

DOL delivered a strong Q2 with 4.9% comp growth (driven by traffic), gross margin expansion, and EPS up 14% Y/Y. International momentum accelerated with Mexico entry and TRS acquisition, extending growth runway. Guidance reaffirmed for the Canadian segment, and we see upside given core resilience and underappreciated global optionality.

**Investment Thesis.** We believe DOL is well-positioned to keep growing share via its low-pricing strategy and new store openings. In addition, DOL is expanding in LATAM and Australia, much of which is not included in current cons ests. DOL has a strong track record of generating cash,investing for growth, and returning value to shareholders via repurchases and dividends.

**1) Solid Comps and Top-Line Beat.** Q2 comp sales grew 4.9% vs. cons: 4.1%, driven by +3.9% transactions and +0.9% ticket. Consumables remained the key driver, while general merchandise and seasonal were stable. Total sales rose 10.3% Y/Y to C$1.72B, ahead of C$1.69B consensus, aided by 27 net new Canadian stores and initial contribution from Australia.

**2) Margin Expansion Despite Integration Costs.** Gross margin improved 30bps y/y to 45.5% (vs. cons: 45.2%), benefiting from lower logistics costs. EBITDA margin expanded to 34.1% vs. 33.5% last year, with EBITDA of C$588.5M topping Street (C$571M). EPS of C$1.16 grew 13.7% y/y and matched consensus despite higher SG&A from TRS integration and one-time costs.

**3) International Growth Milestones.** Dollarcity opened its first store in Mexico and added 14 net new stores (total 658). DOL also closed its acquisition of The Reject Shop (395 stores) in Australia,marking entry into a third continent. These steps significantly broaden DOL's long-term growth runway.

**1) New Acquisition Slightly Pressures SG&A.** Higher SG&A at 14.0% of sales (vs. 13.6% LY) reflects TRS integration and transaction costs. Looking ahead, DOL expects to continue to invest in the Australian business.

**1) Canadian Core Remains Resilient.** FY26 guidance reaffirmed: comps 3-4%, GM 44.2-45.2%,SG&A 14.2-14.7%, capex C$285-330M. Management expects to finish at the high end of comp and margin ranges, though consumer fragility and seasonal volatility could temper upside.
Equity ResearchAugust 29,2025

*Prior trading day's closing price unless otherwise noted.
**Randal J. Konik * | Equity Analyst**
**Kylie Coho * | Equity Analyst**
**Mantero Moreno-Cheek * | Equity Associate**

2) International Optionality Underappreciated. Dollarcity's strong growth (+16% sales, higher margins) and Mexico entry, combined with TRS integration, create multi-year levers. TRS transformation (price simplification, assortment overhaul, store conversions) will span 3-4 years, with profitability inflection expected post-2027. Long-term, Australia could scale to 700 stores by 2034, a catalyst not fully reflected in consensus.
Investment Thesis / Where We Differ

We recommend buying shares of DOL as we view the \(C\) as well positioned to gain share in Canada and LATAM via unit expansion and comp growth fueled competitive per- unit pricing and low opening points on a myriad of the consumer goods. The market share gains should generate strong cash flow for the foreseeable future which the company can invest back in the business or return to shareholders via share repurchases or dividends.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Mid-to-Low SD% comp growth aided by +60 new Dollarama units annually on average- Share repurchases to drive EPS growth over the next several years as the logistics network build out weighs on margins- \(\) 223\(PT based on FY2 P/E of\) \sim 42x\$ and EV/EBITDA of \(\sim 26x\)

- Consistent Mid-to-High SD% comp growth aided by 60-70 new Dollarama units annually- Margins continue to expand despite the Western Canada distribution build out- \(\) 265\(PT based on FY2 P/E of\) \sim 46x\$

- Flat to Low SD% comp growth aided by slightly less than 60 new Dollarama units annually- Share repurchases do not offset the margin pressure from the distribution and logistics network build out in Western Canada, resulting in flat-to-low EPS growth- \(\) 135\(PT based on FY2 P/E of\) \sim 29x\$

Top material issue(s): 1) Products and Customers: DOL is committed to providing its customers with affordable and safe products. DOL is working to improve the tracking of E&S components in products. 2) Energy Management: DOL is in the process of upgrading its in- store energy management systems across the network. 3) Labor Force: DOL aims to provide secure, flexible employment opportunities.

Company Target(s): 1) Reduce Scope 1- 2 GHG emissions intensity to 4.2 kCO2e/f12 by FY31. 2) Retrofit all light fixtures and exterior neon signage to LED lighting. 3) Increase waste diversion rates. 4) Maintain high rates of internal promotions from Assistant Team Leader to Regional District Manager positions.

Qs to mgmt: 1) How does your climate strategy affect your cost structure? 2) What are your current priorities when it comes to your GHG emissions and energy management initiatives? 3) How does labor management affect your strategic priorities?
Multiline and Specialty Retailers & Distributors ESG Integration Refresh

- Market share gains from continuing to invest in price and grow units in under penetrated geographies- Western Canada logistics and distribution rollout weighs on margin expansion in the near-term but produces long-term productivity gains- Dollarcity successfully enters Mexico, growing the brand's sales potential

Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates.

Dollarama IncLeading Canadian value retailer. Dollarama has a fixed price point, is expanding stores, and sources merchandise from overseas vendors. It also has a majority stake in Dollarcity, a similar model to Dollarama, based on LATAM. Looking ahead, the company plans to grow through unit expansion (Dollarama in Canada and Dollarcity in existing countries with plans to enter Mexico).

Our \(\) 223\(PT is based on a FY2 P/E of \~43x and EV/EBITDA of \~26x supported by our analysis of historical trading patterns. Risks include but are not limited to: the health of the Canadian consumer, increased competition, execution risk regarding its organic growth plans and Western Canada distribution buildup.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) \ \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus\) 20\% \(or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/Growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Dollarama Inc (DOL CN: C\$185.05, BUY)

**Notes:** Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
